items.title: [The Guardian Global Development] ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre being turned into an energy colony‚Äô: Argentina‚Äôs nuclear plan faces backlash over US interests
items.content_html:
Push to restart uranium mining in Patagonia has sparked fears about the environmental impact and loss of sovereignty over key resources

On an outcrop above the Chubut River, one of the few to cut across the arid Patagonian steppe of southern Argentina, Sergio Pichi√±√°n points across a wide swath of scrubland to colourful rock formations on a distant hillside.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs where they dug for uranium before, and when the miners left, they left the mountain destroyed, the houses abandoned, and nobody ever studied the water,‚Äù he says, citing suspicions arising from cases of cancer and skin diseases in his community. ‚ÄúIf they want to open this back up, we‚Äôre all pretty worried around here.‚Äù
